page.title: 06PEBMARSH PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The building is on high ground looking over meadows and has a good view of{ {St.John the Baptist's Church,}from which it takes its name. The school was designed in September 1964 by the County Architect from Chelmsford. Tanner and Wicks,local builders,began work in February 1965. The building was finished in 1966 and dedicated by John Tiarks,Bishop of Chelmsford,on{19th September 1966.} Built for 80 children,the school has {three classrooms,a small hall,an {office}and{a kitchen}for cooking children's lunches.Outside,there is a {hard playing surface,playing field} and{garden.} In June 1985 there are{74 children}on roll,a{Headmaster}and{two full-time {teachers. { }
